result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Anthony Sciano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Anthony Sciano is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark Anthony Sciano was found guilty of OWI (4th), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Mark Anthony Sciano was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, to be paid by 07/27/2017. Any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.
Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 30 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court ordered AODA assessment.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended

11-21-2016/ Judge Jean M Kies   *
Defendant is non-compliant.
The privileges previously granted are cancelled and the defendant is  sentenced to ordinary confinement for the balance of the term heretofore imposed.     *
Concurrent with: concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 16 days time served.  Huber privileges for work, medical/dental treatment and treatment ONLY.
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 07/27/2017. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Concurrent with: concurrent to Count 1 and to any other sentence; release for work, treatment and medical/dental treatment; with credit for 16 days time served.
Provide a DNA sample, if not already done.

records.addlTxt: reflects 11-21-16 Court order cancelling Huber privileges
Order For Cancellation of Huber/Work Release/Electronic Surveillance Privileges Pursuant To Wisconsin Statutes Section 303.08(2), 973.09(4), 973.03(4) received and filed with the court.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Kies Br 45 for review. os
Received on behalf of the defendant and filed. LNR

Defendant Mark Anthony Sciano in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LNR  

Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 & 3: 

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 1: 

Court ordered defendant to serve 200 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 16 days time served.  Huber privileges for work, medical/dental treatment and treatment ONLY. Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $600.00 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, to be paid by 07/27/2017. Any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.  Court ordered AODA assessment.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 30 months.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 30 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  

AS TO COUNT 3: 

Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction concurrent to Count 1 and to any other sentence; release for work, treatment and medical/dental treatment; with credit for 16 days time served. 

- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 07/27/2017. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.  
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.
